title: Cowork: Claude Code for the rest of your work
summary:
Claude has launched "Cowork," a research preview designed to bring the advanced capabilities of Claude Code to a wider audience beyond developers. Available to Claude Max subscribers on macOS, Cowork allows users to grant Claude access to a specific folder on their computer, enabling it to read, edit, and create files within it.

Unlike a typical conversation, Cowork gives Claude greater agency. Once assigned a task, Claude autonomously plans and executes the work—such as organizing downloads, creating spreadsheets from screenshots, or drafting reports from notes—while keeping the user informed. It integrates with existing connectors for external data and introduces new skills for document and presentation creation. When combined with Claude in Chrome, it can also perform browser-based tasks. This system aims to simplify workflows by reducing manual context provision and allowing parallel task processing.

User control is paramount: users explicitly choose which folders Claude can access, and Claude seeks approval before taking significant actions. However, users are cautioned about potential risks like accidental destructive actions (e.g., file deletion) if instructions are unclear, and "prompt injections" from external content. These risks are inherent to advanced AI tools with real-world agency.

As a research preview, Cowork will undergo rapid improvements based on user feedback, with future plans including cross-device sync and Windows compatibility, alongside continued safety enhancements.
chinese_title: 协作：Claude 代码，包揽您余下工作
chinese_summary:
Claude 推出了“Cowork”，这是一个研究预览版，旨在将 Claude Code 的先进功能带给更广泛的受众，而不仅仅是开发者。Cowork 面向 macOS 上的 Claude Max 订阅用户提供，它允许用户授予 Claude 访问其电脑上特定文件夹的权限，使其能够在该文件夹内读取、编辑和创建文件。

与典型的对话不同，Cowork 赋予了 Claude 更大的自主权。一旦分配任务，Claude 便会自主规划和执行工作——例如整理下载文件、根据截图创建电子表格或根据笔记起草报告——同时让用户了解进展。它集成了现有连接器以获取外部数据，并引入了用于文档和演示文稿创建的新技能。当与 Chrome 中的 Claude 结合使用时，它还可以执行基于浏览器的任务。该系统旨在通过减少手动提供上下文和允许并行处理任务来简化工作流程。

用户控制至关重要：用户明确选择 Claude 可以访问的文件夹，并且 Claude 在采取重大行动之前会寻求批准。然而，用户需警惕潜在风险，例如指令不明确时可能导致意外的破坏性操作（例如文件删除），以及来自外部内容的“提示注入”。这些风险是具有实际操作能力的先进 AI 工具所固有的。

作为一项研究预览，Cowork 将根据用户反馈进行快速改进，未来计划包括跨设备同步和 Windows 兼容性，以及持续的安全增强。

title: FBI raids Washington Post reporter's home
summary:
The FBI raided the Virginia home of Washington Post reporter Hannah Natanson early Wednesday, seizing her electronic devices including a phone and laptops, a move the newspaper termed "highly unusual and aggressive." The raid is part of an investigation into Aurelio Perez-Lugones, a government contractor accused of illegally retaining classified materials.

Attorney General Pam Bondi confirmed the raid was conducted at the Pentagon's request, targeting a journalist obtaining and reporting classified information from Perez-Lugones, who is already in custody. Bondi stated the Trump administration would not tolerate illegal leaks posing national security risks. Despite the raid, agents told Natanson she was not the focus of the investigation or accused of wrongdoing, and neither she nor the Post were notified they were targets.

The Washington Post's executive editor, Matt Murray, condemned the "extraordinary, aggressive action," raising "profound questions and concern around the constitutional protections for our work." Natanson covers the federal workforce and has previously detailed receiving sensitive information from government employees.

Press freedom groups unanimously denounced the raid as a "tremendous intrusion" and an "alarming escalation" in the administration's "war on press freedom." They cited federal laws and constitutional protections for journalists, warning that such searches endanger confidential sources, impede public interest reporting, and are characteristic of authoritarian regimes. They demanded a public explanation for the search's necessity and legality, emphasizing its chilling effect on journalism amidst the Post's strained relationship with the Trump administration.
chinese_title: FBI突袭《华盛顿邮报》记者住所
chinese_summary:
联邦调查局于周三凌晨突袭了《华盛顿邮报》记者汉娜·纳坦森位于弗吉尼亚州的住所，查获了她的电子设备，包括一部手机和多台笔记本电脑。《华盛顿邮报》称此举“极不寻常且具有侵略性”。此次突袭是一项调查的一部分，旨在调查政府承包商奥雷利奥·佩雷斯-卢戈内斯，他被指控非法保留机密材料。

司法部长帕姆·邦迪证实，此次突袭是应五角大楼要求进行的，目标是一名记者，该记者从已在押的佩雷斯-卢戈内斯那里获取并报道机密信息。邦迪表示，特朗普政府不会容忍构成国家安全风险的非法泄密。尽管进行了突袭，但探员告诉纳坦森，她不是调查的重点，也未被指控有不当行为，她和《华盛顿邮报》均未被告知他们是目标。

《华盛顿邮报》执行主编马特·默里谴责了这一“非同寻常的侵略性行动”，引发了“深刻的疑问和担忧”，围绕我们工作的宪法保护。纳坦森负责报道联邦政府雇员事务，此前曾详细描述过收到来自政府雇员的敏感信息。

新闻自由团体一致谴责此次突袭是“巨大的侵扰”，以及政府“对新闻自由的战争”中“令人警觉的升级”。他们援引联邦法律和对记者的宪法保护，警告此类搜查危及秘密消息来源，阻碍公共利益报道，并且是威权政权的特征。他们要求公开解释此次搜查的必要性和合法性，强调在《华盛顿邮报》与特朗普政府关系紧张之际，此举对新闻业造成的寒蝉效应。

title: Apple Creator Studio
summary:
Apple today announced Apple Creator Studio, a new subscription service launching January 28, 2026, priced at $12.99 per month or $129 per year, with a one-month free trial and discounted student pricing. This comprehensive suite provides powerful creative apps for video editing, music making, creative imaging, and visual productivity across Mac, iPad, and iPhone.

The collection includes Final Cut Pro, Logic Pro, Pixelmator Pro, Motion, Compressor, and MainStage. Additionally, it enhances Keynote, Pages, Numbers, and Freeform with new AI features and premium content.

Key innovations include:
*   **Video Editing (Final Cut Pro, Motion, Compressor):** New AI features like Transcript Search, Visual Search, Beat Detection, and Montage Maker (iPad) streamline video workflows. Motion introduces Magnetic Mask for easy object isolation.
*   **Music Creation (Logic Pro, MainStage):** Logic Pro gains AI-powered Synth Player and Chord ID for intelligent music composition, a new Sound Library (Mac), Quick Swipe Comping (iPad), and natural language search for loops (iPad).
*   **Creative Imaging (Pixelmator Pro):** Makes its debut on iPad, fully optimized for touch and Apple Pencil, bringing advanced editing tools, a new Warp tool, and intelligent features like Super Resolution.
*   **Visual Productivity (Keynote, Pages, Numbers, Freeform):** Subscribers gain access to a Content Hub for high-quality media, new premium templates, and advanced AI image creation and editing tools.

Apple Creator Studio aims to empower professionals, emerging artists, entrepreneurs, students, and educators with studio-grade tools, building on Apple's commitment to creators while offering flexibility through subscription or individual app purchases.
chinese_title: 苹果创作者工作室
chinese_summary:
Apple today announced Apple Creator Studio, a new subscription service launching January 28, 2026, priced at $12.99 per month or $129 per year, with a one-month free trial and discounted student pricing. This comprehensive suite provides powerful creative apps for video editing, music making, creative imaging, and visual productivity across Mac, iPad, and iPhone.

The collection includes Final Cut Pro, Logic Pro, Pixelmator Pro, Motion, Compressor, and MainStage. Additionally, it enhances Keynote, Pages, Numbers, and Freeform with new AI features and premium content.

Key innovations include:
*   **Video Editing (Final Cut Pro, Motion, Compressor):** New AI features like Transcript Search, Visual Search, Beat Detection, and Montage Maker (iPad) streamline video workflows. Motion introduces Magnetic Mask for easy object isolation.
*   **Music Creation (Logic Pro, MainStage):** Logic Pro gains AI-powered Synth Player and Chord ID for intelligent music composition, a new Sound Library (Mac), Quick Swipe Comping (iPad), and natural language search for loops (iPad).
*   **Creative Imaging (Pixelmator Pro):** Makes its debut on iPad, fully optimized for touch and Apple Pencil, bringing advanced editing tools, a new Warp tool, and intelligent features like Super Resolution.
*   **Visual Productivity (Keynote, Pages, Numbers, Freeform):** Subscribers gain access to a Content Hub for high-quality media, new premium templates, and advanced AI image creation and editing tools.

Apple Creator Studio aims to empower professionals, emerging artists, entrepreneurs, students, and educators with studio-grade tools, building on Apple's commitment to creators while offering flexibility through subscription or individual app purchases.

title: We can't have nice things because of AI scrapers
summary:
The "article," titled "We can't have nice things because of AI scrapers," presents its core argument through the ironic juxtaposition of its title and content. The title immediately suggests that the pervasive use of AI-driven web scraping negatively impacts the quality or accessibility of online resources and user experiences.

The accompanying content directly illustrates this premise by displaying a common anti-bot security message: "正在确认你是不是机器人！ 加载中...请稍等，我们需要在继续之前检查您的连接安全性。" (Confirming you are not a robot! Loading...Please wait, we need to check your connection security before continuing.)

This security check, which interrupts user flow and demands verification, is a direct countermeasure against automated access, including sophisticated AI scrapers. Therefore, the article's main point is conveyed by showing that the very necessity of implementing such protective measures—designed to combat AI scrapers—is what creates friction and inconvenience for legitimate human users, thus preventing them from having an unhindered "nice thing" (a seamless online experience). The key information is that AI scraping necessitates burdensome security checks, making online interactions less enjoyable.
chinese_title: 因为AI爬虫，我们享受不了好东西了。
chinese_summary:
这篇题为《因为AI爬虫，我们无法拥有美好的事物》的“文章”，通过标题与内容的讽刺性并置，提出了其核心论点。标题立即表明，人工智能驱动的网络爬虫的普遍使用，负面影响了在线资源和用户体验的质量或可访问性。

随附的内容通过显示一个常见的反机器人安全消息，直接阐述了这一前提：“正在确认你是不是机器人！加载中...请稍等，我们需要在继续之前检查您的连接安全性。”

这种中断用户流程并要求验证的安全检查，是针对自动化访问（包括复杂的AI爬虫）的直接对策。因此，文章的主要观点是通过展示以下事实来传达的：实施这些旨在打击AI爬虫的保护措施的必要性，正是给合法的真人用户造成摩擦和不便的原因，从而阻止他们拥有一个畅通无阻的“美好的事物”（即无缝的在线体验）。关键信息是，AI爬虫使得繁琐的安全检查成为必需，使在线互动体验变得不那么愉快。

title: Chromium Has Merged JpegXL
summary:
The article's title, "Chromium Has Merged JpegXL," indicates a significant development regarding the integration of the JpegXL image format into the Chromium project.

However, the provided content does not elaborate on this technical merger. Instead, the content is a generic message instructing users to enable JavaScript in their browser settings to use PolyGerrit, and then refresh the page.

Therefore, while the title suggests a key update regarding Chromium's support for JpegXL, the accompanying text offers no further details or context about this development.
chinese_title: Chromium 已合并 JpegXL
chinese_summary: 文章标题“Chromium 已合并 JpegXL”表明了 JpegXL 图像格式集成到 Chromium 项目中的一项重要进展。然而，所提供的内容并未详细阐述这一技术合并。相反，内容只是一条通用消息，指示用户在其浏览器设置中启用 JavaScript 以使用 PolyGerrit，然后刷新页面。因此，尽管标题暗示了 Chromium 对 JpegXL 支持的关键更新，但附带的文本并未提供有关此进展的进一步细节或背景信息。

title: Scott Adams has died
summary:
Scott Adams, the acclaimed creator of the "Dilbert" comic strip, died at 68 on January 13, 2026, following a battle with prostate cancer that had spread to his bones. His ex-wife, Shelly Miles, confirmed his death during a livestream, noting Adams had revealed on New Year's Day that his health outlook had become "essentially zero."

Adams left a "final message" written on New Year's Day, where he stated his body failed before his brain. He also revealed a late-life conversion, accepting Jesus Christ as his lord and savior at the persuasion of Christian friends, despite previously not being a believer. Miles described his passing as peaceful, surrounded by loved ones.

"Dilbert," launched in 1989, achieved wide acclaim for its satire of corporate life, earning Adams a Reuben Award and extensive global syndication. However, his career faced significant challenges in 2023 when many newspapers stopped running the strip due to racist comments he made, labeling Black people a "hate group." Following this controversy, Adams relaunched the comic as a webcomic, "Daily Dilbert Reborn."

Adams authored several books in addition to his cartoon work. In his final letter, he expressed having an "amazing life," wishing his legacy to be one of usefulness and conveying his love for his audience.
chinese_title: 斯科特·亚当斯逝世
chinese_summary:
《呆伯特》漫画的著名创作者斯科特·亚当斯于2026年1月13日去世，享年68岁，他因与扩散至骨骼的前列腺癌抗争后不治离世。他的前妻雪莉·迈尔斯在一次直播中证实了他的死讯，提到亚当斯曾在元旦透露他的健康状况已“基本归零”。

亚当斯在元旦留下了一份“遗言”，其中他表示自己的身体比大脑先衰竭。他还透露自己晚年皈依基督教，在基督徒朋友的劝说下接受了耶稣基督为他的主和救主，尽管他此前并非信徒。迈尔斯形容他走得很安详，亲友们都陪伴在他身边。

《呆伯特》于1989年问世，因其对公司生活的讽刺而广受好评，为亚当斯赢得了鲁宾奖，并在全球范围内广泛连载。然而，他的职业生涯在2023年遭遇重大挑战，当时许多报纸因他发表种族主义言论，称黑人为“仇恨团体”而停止刊登该漫画。此次争议之后，亚当斯将这部漫画重新推出为网络漫画，名为《呆伯特每日重生》。

除了漫画作品，亚当斯还著有多本书籍。在他的最后一封信中，他表示自己度过了“非凡的一生”，希望自己的遗产能有益于他人，并向他的读者表达了爱意。
